Usage notes
subSections.text: The reading ''hō'' is more common when used as a standalone noun.

subSections.title: Etymology 3
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|つら}}
Of same origin as {{m|ja|列||tr=''tsura''|a string or lineup of things}}. Extending from the meaning of "lineup", the meaning changed to indicate the side of the items lined up. In reference to people, this came to mean the cheeks as the side of the face, and then by extension the face as a whole.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|つら}}

# the [[cheek]]s
# the [[face]] (usually written {{l|ja|面}})
# one's [[facial expression]]
# the [[side]] of something
# the [[surface]] or [[front]] of something
# one's [[honor]]: "[[face]]" as in [[save face]] or [[lose face]]
